comment: There are a couple of group projects, you choose your group the first day of class and cannot change . He gives study guides for tests. His tests are fairly easy, but you cannot rely on only the PowerPoint he gives in class. You have to read your textbook and use other resources. He gives five bonus points for attendance at the end of the semester
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: VERY lecture heavy. Go to class and you get extra credit points. There are a few group work projects throughout the semester so make sure you choose your groups wisely. Some questions on the test were not covered in class but he does give you study guides to prepare for every test. Make sure you understand everything covered in depth for each test.

All tests are open book. Attendance gives you 5 bonus points at the end of the semester. Is understanding if you have a medical condition & skip class a lot. soft spoken. reads from powerpoints. mindnumbing.

This man effectively lost control of his own class within the first two weeks. 50% drop rate. He will assign group projects on the first day of class and will expect more than the guidelines set out in the assignment. The group project is affected by all the students dropping, and he will not assign you a new group because he doesn't answer emails.
Accent is so thick you can't translate anything he's saying from the front row.  Test's didn't pertain to half of the material covered. Will avoid any further classes.

He has a strong Ghana accent so be prepared for that. His lectures are EXTREMELY boring. A side effect is wanting to throw yourself out the window. With his garbled words, quiet voice, and boring lectures, beware this class. World Civilizations is an interesting class study but not with this professor. Don't take his class!
very nice guy!!! knows what he is talking about. He is not too demanding but expect you to be actively engaged. Exams are easy and he is lenient grading them too. I enjoyed his class very much.

Very nice guy and grading is straightforward, though tests are done in class w/o notes and can be difficult. Does include a group project w/o class time to organize and several groups had dead members.

Was never present during office hours, never replied to emails, said he would provide study guides and failed to do so consistently. Failed entire class on assignments based on criteria that was never discussed at the time assignments were given. Expect the class to be taught almost exclusively by youtube videos (which are free to access you know).

I had to drop this class immediately. He is too boring and all over the place in lectures. If you like good discussion or upbeat classes, this is not for you. Take the other culture science options because he is the only instructor for this class.
Decent professor.  He is not very interesting then neither is the subject.
easy class watched youtube sometimes. gives you a study guide for every test.hard to understand and test are difficult if you dont study

This man look like Uncle Ben! I swear to god when he brought his briefcase in - I was waiting for him to pull out a bowl of rice! Sitting through lecture was torture!Very monotone! I fell alseep nearly every day. Don't buy the book, bc you wont use it! Studdy guide(s) are the test.

the most boring class I have ever taken. Don't buy the book because he gives you a packet of notes and a study guide for every test. He takes attendance every class and it's really hard to understand his accent. You can tell he knows what he's talking about and is very educated, he's just not a good teacher.

Great class! Very knowledgeable professor; his monotonous tone makes a little difficult to focus and understand.If you want to do good, go to class every day, take his review guides for the test seriously and you'll make an easy A. Didn't love the 5 group projects, but it could be worse.

Very, very easy class.  He's very passionate about the subject so if you can get past the monotonic nature of his lectures, you will enjoy it.  I just really didn't like the 5 group presentations-but they were pretty easy.  His tests are a joke-if you look at the study guide it will take you 5 minutes to complete each test.

Great teacher. I enjoyed this class very much. especially the group projects and class discussions expanded my world view. Study the one page test guide and do your group projects and you'll be ok. attendance is mandatory.

Great professor. The class is more interesting if you participate, he is more than willing to talk about any related topics, that might be in the news. If no one participates than the class isnt as interesting. He is a nice guy, has very interesting views, i spoke to him alot after class.
He emails out a study guide, which if you study, will help you pass the class. He has a dreadful monotone, and it is hard to pay attention.

My interest for this class died quickly after i heard him speak for the first time. Not only can he barely speak english, but he talks in circles leaving you completely in the dark. He gives you 15+ page study notes and his "study guides" basically spell out his tests. Lots of memorization. Very disappointed.
Agree with previous assesments. Use the notes he gives, since he bases his tests on those. The mandatory attendance treats you like you're in high school still. He needs to work on that. Nice guy.
No Comments

So this killed my interest in World Religions. The class was easy as long as you got your hands on the study guide, otherwise good luck! His lecture was nearly incomprehensible and completely unreleated to the tests. Manadatory attendance! Very frustrating for such a boring class. Ridiculous group projects that don't help you learn anything at all.

Yea it is hard to under stand him. As long as You read the notes he emails you and do the study guide you should pass the class with a least a B. Bring some homework from another class to do in his class because it is really boring. No exam for his class instead if have a group project that you have to do.

I can hardly understand what he says sometimes.  You can tell that he is smart and usually can relates other religions together, but his presentation skills are amiss and he's not organized.  The tests are okay, but only because he gives you a 15+ page of notes AND a study guide.  The class isn't too hard, but boring and frustrating.
